title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about racial injustice and childhood in the Deep South, seen through the eyes of young Scout Finch.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel about totalitarianism, surveillance, and the destruction of truth.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A portrait of the Jazz Age and a critique of the American Dream, centered on Jay Gatsby's obsessive love for Daisy Buchanan.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: Holden Caulfield's tale of teenage angst and alienation in postwar America.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A witty exploration of manners, upbringing, and marriage in early 19th-century England, focused on Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins sets out on an unexpected journey with dwarves and a wizard to reclaim treasure from a dragon.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A sweeping narrative of human history â€” how Homo sapiens came to dominate the planet.

title: Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship
author: Robert C. Martin
description: Practical advice and best practices for writing readable, maintainable code.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: A guide to building good habits and breaking bad ones using small behavior changes.

title: The Pragmatic Programmer: Your Journey to Mastery (20th Anniversary Edition)
author: Andrew Hunt, David Thomas
description: Timeless practical advice and principles for software developers to write better software and build a better career.
